module.p: toiseach start, beginning is a masculine common noun, with genitive singular toisich, and plural toisichean.

section.p: The sense of toiseach depends on the kind of entity decribed by its specifier.
When the specifier is an abstract noun describing a situation or period of time, toiseach picks out the starting point.

Pedagogical examples –
toiseach an t-samhraidh
the start/beginning of summer td. 380
toiseach a’ mhìos seo / toiseach na bliadhna
the beginning of this month / the beginning of the year td. 591

cf. toiseach tòiseachaidh very beginning
Chan e bha seo ach toiseach tòiseachaidh.
This was just the very beginning. td. 591
When the specifier is an abstract noun describing a property, toiseach picks out the starting point of the associated situation.

Pedagogical examples –
Is e eagal an Tighearna toiseach a’ ghliocais.
Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. td. 591 the start of one being wise
When the specifier is a concrete noun describing a material object, toiseach picks out the front part of the object.

Pedagogical examples –
(ann an) toiseach a’ chàir / anns an toiseach
(in) the front of the car / in the front [e.g. of the car] td. 591
ann an toiseach na làraidh
in the front (i.e. cab) of the lorry td. 380

cf. toiseach luinge forecastle, toiseach cathabattlefront, toiseach an airm vanguard (of the army), cas thoisich foreleg, front leg, an comhair a thoisich frontwards, front end first (lit. in the direction of his front part).

module.p: (ann) an toiseach (at) first, in the beginning.

Pedagogical examples –
Thàinig Flòraidh an toiseach.
Flora came first / was first to arrive. td. 380
Cha bu toil leam e an toiseach.
I didn’t like him at first. td. 380
Albannach an toiseach, Breatannach a-rithist mar gm bitheadh
A Scot first, a Briton next as it were td. 591

Examples from Gairm –
Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn. [...] Cha b’ fhuilear do dhuine de ’n t-seòrsa so tomhas mhath de chumhachd a bhith aige. [...] Bhiodh a leòr aige ri dhèanamh an toiseach ag ath-nuadhachadh dreach a’ Chomuinn.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General who will oversee the Society’s work. [...] A person of this kind would have to have a good measure of power. [...] He would initially have enough to do restructuring the Society. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’
(ann an) toiseach tòiseachaidh in the very beginning, originally is an emphatic variant of (ann) an toiseach.
an toiseach air ahead of, in front of is a prepositional compound.

Pedagogical examples –
Bha iad an toiseach air an luing eile.
They were ahead of the other boat. td. 591
Bha e an toiseach orm.
He was ahead of me. td. 591
air thoiseach ahead, before, foremost, in front, first.

Pedagogical examples –
Bithidh feum orra anns na bliadhnachan air thoiseach.
They will be needed in the years ahead. td. 591
Tha m’ uaireadair air thoiseach.
My watch is fast. td. 591
Is beag a bha fios aige dè bha air thoiseach.
Little did he know what was ahead. td. 591
air thùs is air thoiseach
first and foremost td. 591
air thoiseach air ahead of, in front of, before is a prepositional compound.

Pedagogical examples –
Bha e a’ coiseachd roimhe, fada air thoiseach oirnn.
He was walking along, far ahead / a long way in front of us. td. 380
air thoiseach air na dùthchannan eile
ahead of the other countries td. 380 probably metaphorical
Mhothaich mi gun robh fear eile mu cheud meatair air thoiseach orm.
I noticed that there was another man about a hundred metres ahead of me. td. 591–2
Tha e fada air thoiseach air rud sam bith eile.
It’s far ahed of anything else. td. 592
Tha e a-nis leis an dream ghràidh a tha air dol dhachaigh air thoiseach oirnn.
He is now with the beloved people who have gone on ahead of us [i.e. who have died]. td. 592

Examples from Gairm –
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. Cuin a chualas ball-Pàrlarnaid a’ togail a ghuth a dh’ iarraidh leasachaidh do staid Gàidhlig ann an Albainn? Am bi cothrom a nis aig cuideigin a ghuth a thogail, anns an t-suidheachadh iongantach a th’ againn anns a’ Phàrlamaid ùr? Chan eil sinn ag iarraidh air an duine so, ma tha e ann, a’ Ghàidhlig a chur air thoiseach air lòn is obair is caitheamh-beatha an t-sluaigh. Chan eil sinn ag iarraidh ach beagan ceartais.
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. When has a member of Parliament been heard raising his voice to demand improvement for the state of Gaelic in Scotland? Will someone have an opportunity now to raise his voice, in the unexpected situation we have in the new Parliament? We are not asking of this person, if he exists, to prioritise Gaelic over food and jobs and the population’s standard of living. We only want a modicum of justice. td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’

Pedagogical examples –
Thàinig esan air toiseach.
He arrived first. td. 592
faigh air toiseach air
forestall td. 592
(bh)o thoiseach from the start/beginning/outset, cf. bho.

Pedagogical examples –
Carson nach do leig e air o thoiseach mu na b’aithne dha?
Why didn’t he reveal from the start about what he knew? td. 591
o thoiseach a’ mhìos seo / o thoiseach na bliadhna
from the beginning of this month / from the beginning of the year td. 591
o thoiseach gu deireadh
from beginning to end td. 591
toiseachail incipient, preliminary is an adjective.
toiseachd priority is a feminine derived noun.
tòisich start, begin, commence, inaugurate, launch, originate is a verb, derived from the noun toiseach, and with verbal noun tòiseachadh
